Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Use embedded resources for OpenXmlCompositeElement tests" (#402) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Opened issue "Version 2.8.1 with .NET 4.7.1 creates dozens of unneeded library references" (#401) at OfficeDev/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Description**

If you add version 2.8.1 (via NuGet) to a project that targets .NET 4.7.1, then it will pull down dozens of System.X libraries, some of which will causes reference issues with larger projects. 

**Information**

- .NET Target: 4.7.1
- DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.8.1

**Repro**
Create a new solution with a console app project targeting 4.7.1. Add version 2.8.1 via NuGet. 

**Observed**

Dozens of extra unneeded libraries are added. 

**Expected**

It should only add 3 additional libraries: 
* Microsoft.NETCore.Platforms
* NETStandard.Library
* System.IO.Packaging

**Workaround**
If you install NETStandard.Library before DocumentFormat.OpenXml, and upgrade Microsoft.NETCore.Platforms, then only additional library installed is System.IO.Packaging.

simple change with lots of moves:

Merged pull request "Remove dependency on MediaDataPartType, which doesn't contain MP4" (#110) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody: MediaDataPartType isn't really needed. It's only used to find the content type and file extension for a media file, and we already have those from the previous media part. Since MediaDataPartType doesn't contain a value for MP4, this Fixes #65.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "DocumentAssembler generates large file" (#202) at OfficeDev/Open-Xml-PowerTools
Events.RelatedBody:
The size of the Assembled Document is around the same size as the template (word doc) from which it was produced. In my current case, this is a problem, because my word doc template is 27 megs, but has numerous conditionals (especially around large images I need to hide/show based on data). 

After the doc is assembled, I expect the assembled file to only be around 5 megs. Testing this assertion, I can open the 27 meg assembled document into MS Word, make a small change (add a space for example), save it, and now the saved file is only around 5 megs. This can make a huge difference in user experience, for example, when my users attempt to use my generated document as attachments in mail systems with attachment size limits.

Hi any plans to include something image support like this fork 

https://github.com/krembf/Open-Xml-PowerTools/commit/3779fc4f8ed11432b81f133a095f0fc3fe84c86e

Thanks in advance!
